title: A mid-morning snack
text: Had a mid-morning snack waiting for a friend. I tried a green detox smoothie, a chocolate dessert and to drink hot chocolate. All were excellent and well presented. It’s a down to earth place, a bit out of the way, but definitely worth the trip.

title: Thoroughly disappointing!!
text: If you are looking for Hindu flavor and good service, keep looking elsewhere. We ordered a plate that was supposedly for two, curry flavored seafood. Due to coronavirus, the restaurant only has delivery. After 2:15 of wait time the food finally arrived. And unfortunately it was not worth the wait. The portion size was for one person, barely, but priced for three or four. The taste was barely recognizable Hindu, the nana bread was terrible, and the dessert had a foul taste. It has to be one of the worst dining experience of my life. Thoroughly disappointing ls an understatement. Definitely won’t be trying this place ever again.

title: Amazing historical site
text: I was weary of the uphill climb to the top. Oh, but how much it was worth. The site is impecable, the explanation for each place is clear and compelling. We went after 3pm which was great because the sun was not as hot.

title: What a view!
text: What a view! By far the best of any of the terraces with a view of Acropolis. Had drinks with a fabulous platter of cheese. Also tried the desserts, exquisite. The best was the cheesecake. The waitress spoke perfect English and was ever so nice.

title: A souvlaki to remember!
text: Amazing service and atmosphere. The food was spectacular. One of the best places we went to during this trip.

title: Great little place!
text: Came during the off season and lucky for us it was open. We had dessert, tiramisu and lemon pie, both delicious. The hostess was very nice, speaks English, and the music was amazing.

title: Octupus tacos!! (You read that right)
text: Recently opened bar, very well located within walking distance of all major hotels in Zone 10. Friendly staff, full bar with wide variety, and what blew me away, octopus tacos. Worth the trip here just to try these. They have other prepared dishes with octopus. If you are driving, there is limited parking on the street, but recommend finding a parking lot. There are several nearby.

title: Neat and cozy little place
text: Had a chance to have breakfast at Antaño with my daughter and we had an exquisite breakfast. It was hearty and complete, price was good and the service was ok. It is also a great bakery which I have visited many times. However, first time we ate here and it was a pleasant surprise! The nenu looks great and they have a nice wine selection. The waffles are really good.

title: Very cool rides!
text: There are some very nice rides in the newer part of the park. They are quite like the rides you'd find at an amusement park in the US. The rest of the park is very clean, food is ok and pretty inexpensive. Both young kids and teens would enjoy the park. It is very small, so not something that will take up the entire day.

title: Why is this place empty?
text: I have never ever tried such amazing boneless wings, with a "chiltepe" sauce that still makes my mouth water. The place needs a small facelift, kitchen is simple, service is a bit above average. Price is right, bar is stocked up, so I have trouble believing it was empty the Thursday evening I went. Worth making the effort to visit the place for the food. Just around the corner from Intercontinental in Zone 10.

title: Nice place and service....
text: The restaurant is in the Oakland Mall Rooftop area, very nice and excellent for people watching. The service of the place is great, however, there are no different plates from your average steakhouse. So, if you happen to be in the mall and want a good, standard steak, you are in luck. Coming here just for a steak...you may want to look for other options.

title: Great for local scene
text: This is a great place to meet locals and the people from middle class Guatemala. The place is quite colorful and the food is ok. It will never be Zagat rated, but then again, the price is very accessible. I would suggest ordering several plates and sharing them in order to try many of the flavors they have. Worth a shot if you are into meeting the real townspeople.

title: An ok place for budget conscious persons
text: There are a couple of these restaurants in town, and all have the same type of service and food quality. The environment is very local, and you will find mostly locals here. They have a full-service bar and the selection is good. They do have a steak sandwich which is actually pretty good and big for the price. Service is average, and you may find a couple of good waiters at times. Sometimes you may hit live music even. If you are on a budget, this place is great.

title: Sort of like a Fridays
text: This is the local version of a Fridays or Applebees. Food is mostly fried, taste is ok, and quality is a bit above average. Service is ok, and the prices are reasonable. Would suggest coming here for the burgers.

title: Ribs are good....that's about it
text: Restaurant has really good ribs most of the time, but sometimes they run out and must source from a different supplier. This makes for an inconsistent experience. While menu is extensive, the only thing worth coming for here are indeed the ribs. Service is good, and price is reasonable. If you are missing the ribs from back home, give it a try.

title: Very good sushi and good service
text: The place is not flashy but the service is good and the sushi is very good. The selection of rolls is quite extensive and you may try and have the waiter offer some of the new selections. Normally, you will love them. My favorite rolls are the spicy ones.

title: A bit unorganized
text: Went last night with my kids for dinner. The attendant was aloof, and his explanations were not at all helpful. It seemed it was a pain to be explaining the ropes of the new place....we finally ordered and then found no place to sit, as all tables were taken up by large groups just hanging out. We found a place out in the cold next to a fire, which kept us a bit warm. However, the burgers, a chicken sandwich, and grilled cheese we ordered were really good. The hamburger does have a great taste. Too bad the service is not yet up to par. Will give it a chance again in a few weeks.

title: Thursdays is the day
text: Excellent place to go enjoy some Trova. Food is just ok, service is good, but the ambiance and live music make it worth the visit. They do take reservations and I would suggest you call ahead and make a reservation. Place gets packed.

title: Kind of cold and gloomy
text: Starbucks saves this place from going below average. The place simply has not picked up enough business despite the location. It's only an okay place to go. Maybe with time.

title: Great music and drinks
text: Went with a fiend for drinks and the service and overall ambiance was very good. The food is not the greatest, and would only recommend something to accompany your drinks, which is very limited. But the music selection is excellent, and you really get to enjoy the place if you like people watching, especially the locals.

title: Must see place
text: Lots of old history here, a place where Che Guevara used to hand out when in town. Several places here, all make you feel cozy. You can get some pretty decent food, drinks are great, and the service is good. Some spots have live music which is great at times.

title: Great value!
text: Unquestionably the best meat in town, and after the latest wave of price adjustments across the board, the prices here are quite reasonable. Ordering the "Pyrex de Mixto", will give you the best range of flavor. I ask for mine "5/8" cooked. Favorite dessert here is the Babarrua, and the bar is pretty complete.

title: Fancy little corner
text: Exquisite café within the Westin. Excellent for business meetings as it's a quiet place, with excellent coffee and desserts. The service is impecable and the food is really delicious. Any of the desserts are great, but their chocolate ones are awesome!

title: Best buffet in town!
text: The Cafetal is hands down the restaurant with the best buffet in town. They have different types of food every day, the plates are exquisite and complemented by great salads and desserts. My favorite is the Mexican buffet with the seafood one a close second. Not cheap but a great value.

title: Pricey but still good!
text: Ambia has great service and the food is good. It has a great backyard and beautiful garden. It is a great place to go daytime or during the evening. I have not been floored yet by any of the plates, but all are good. The desserts are pretty good, and the wine selection is great. I do feel the prices are a bit steep though. Overall, worth the visit.

title: Nice, but missing harmony
text: Bayside has some very nice places to visit, especially some bars and restaurants, However, being in front of the bay, I feel that the place could be a bit more harmonious with the concept of a tropical beach. You will definitely find some cool places to drink a bit and do some people watching, even find some nice (a bit overpriced) souvenirs However, it still feels like a mall or shopping strip in any other city.

title: Very friendly staff
text: I have gone to many Hooters all arround the world, but this one, like the one in Katy, Texas, has some of the friendliest girls I have met. I did stay until closing time, outer deck, and was never rushed, all the time offering something else to drink or eat, and great conversation. Food is the same, although the Mahi Mahi sandwich was really good.

title: Feel at home in the middle of Brickell!
text: Have spent a week at this new hotel, great restaurant with a Peruvian influence (my favorite was Eggs a la Peruana for breakfast ), super friendly staff....all while in the middle of the financial district. Will definitely congratulate my assistant on a great choice, and want to thank Angeline for making mornings a joyful time. I travel often to Miami so I have found my spot!

title: Free??? Yes, and great service!
text: Took the Coral Way Trolley to and from Miracle Mile area...service runs about every half an hour. Clean units, very cold A/C and used heavily by tourists. Stops at all stops so not really what you want id you are in a hurry. Otherwise, great way yo get around downtown Miami, Coconut Grove and Brickell.

title: Good Peruvian, a bit unorganized
text: Had great hopes for the place as it is Zagat rated. Waiter was a bit unorganized, missed an item from our order. Food was good, actually really good. Service could improve, but waiter was very nice. Had the flounder with a spicy yellow sauce and rice.

title: Whatever you need
text: This mall rivals any mall in North America and Europe. From clothing, DIY store, theaters and restaurants, you can spend a whole day walking the enormous mall. The mall is surrounded by great other shopping areas within walking distance. A definite spot to hit if shopping is your thing.

title: Amazing view and good food
text: Breathtaking view of Lake Atitlan from the terrace. Service is great and the food is good. I had a fried tilapia which was well cooked. Great selection of wines, including French wines. It is a place worth visiting. My other friends asked for sirloin and another asked for shrimp. Both were also ok.

title: Quaint little place!
text: This place had been in my radar for a while, but had never been. It is lovely and the food is delicious. You can actually bring your own booze, no extra for it. They have a one-man-show for live music which is really nice. I suggest going during the evening for dinner. Great for dates.

title: Safe place, great food, nice view!
text: Awesome place for business meetings or simply to have a good lunch or dinner. Some restaurants have a great view of the city, both day and night it looks nice. Several great restaurants to choose from. There are some nice exclusive shops, parking is great, and several of the main corporations have their offices here.

title: Amazing view!
text: Had a great business lunch during a hot day. The view from the terrace is amazing. Service is fast and friendly and the beer is ice cold. If it gets too hot you can always run indoors to the A/C.

title: Very very friendly service
text: I was pleasantly surprised by our waiter who went out of his way to make our visit a good one. The food was hot and good, had a great wine and you can't beat the view in this place. Recommend going at night.

title: Delicioso burrito!
text: Great decor and environment, good sercice and lively music. I had a burrito, enormous and delicious, with a great spicy sauce. It is the best burrito in town. Price was good too. Definitely going back!

title: Tremendous atmosphere!
text: Valeria made this stop worth the visit. The place is great for spending a few hours people watching or just watching a football game. I had the blue cheese burger which was excellent and Pilsen draft beer.

title: Great tasting sandwiches
text: Had a business lunch here and ordered three different sandwiches. All three were delicious! Service was quick and friendly. The only problem was the music. It was way too loud!

title: Good Italian Food
text: Went with my family for lunch. Service is excellent and the plates are large and good-tastijg. The pasta is ok and they have a good selection of wines. I recommend the chicken parmigiana.

title: Very intimate place!
text: You wouldn't be able to tell this is an actual restaurant with such a spectacular atmosphere unless you are guided past the store, café and kitchen back to a superb garden. Once you are there, you are delighted by the food. The extensive menu has items for all palates, and you wish you could have a bigger stomach, for sure. Bring your date here, she will be quite pleased. The food tastes great and service is very good.

title: Fun place for people watching
text: This place is full of tourists from all over the world. Locals can mingle with them, and the atmosphere is very relaxed. Service is ok, and the food is a bit above average. But the nachos are incredible. They also have a seven-layer dip, which is fantastic.

title: Great view from the terrace
text: Small place, but nice location. The best item on the menu is the lava burger, which is quite tasty and big. Enjoy the sun and sights from the terrace. The bar is quite good as well.

title: Perfect place for a date!!
text: Enjoyed a great time at this little place with my date. Crepes are delicious and they have some great wine also. Service is good and the place is very well located. Parking may be an issue at times. Take your gal there!

title: Must see museum for tourists!
text: This private museum located near the hotel zone is just an awesome and complete display of the different indigenous wardrobe, including accessories, all which are hand-woven. You will understand the differences in the clothing from all regions in Guatemala. You can also purchase some premium quality items. Worth the trip.

title: Pleasently surprised!
text: First time flying with Avianca, and I was pleasantly surprised with the service. Amazed we actually got served lunch and free drinks (including a couple of beers). Had a missed connection due to weather, and we were put up in a superb hotel with all meals covered.

title: Very comfy and cozy
text: Spent one night at this truly great hotel. Enjoyed the beautiful pool, great bar and great food from the restaurant. Rooms are huge and very luxurious. A great value near the airport. The staff is so friendly, patient and helpful.

title: Great bar scene, good food
text: Spent a great Tuesday evening here, excellent bar and good food. They start you off with a guacamole and chips. I had the enchiladas with mole which were ok. The food needs a little bit more of the Mexican flavor to be excellent. Overall a great evening.
place: Rocco's Tacos & Tequila Bar - Fort Lauderdale

title: Great greek food!
text: Came with some colleagues to talk business and watch a basketball game. Food is really good (gyro, flamed cheese and beef tips). Service a bit slow, it mught have been understaffed. Nice place to chat, great for people watching.

title: Best Cuban food in town
text: Feel like you are really in Cuba in this place. The food is superb and service is good. The seafood is very well seasoned, tastes great. It is a bit crowded for lunch, and you may wait a bit. Dinner is less crowded.

title: Nicest and friendly service
text: Loved the attention we received here. The food was great, we tried two types of pizza and fettuccine Alfredo. Great taste. They serve no alcohol though. Ask for Cristina, lovely person.

title: Budget fun!
text: Donde Joselito is an off-the-beaten-path place. The sirloin and tenderloin steaks are very good, the service is great, and it can get pretty loud at times. Parking is a bit of a hassle, so get there a tad early for lunch. Great place to spend a lazy afternoon.

title: Good mexican food
text: This is a go-to place when you want a good plate of Mexican food. I love the mole chicken and the fajitas. Margaritas are great, and free for the ladies on Thursdays. Great selection of tequilas.

title: Spectacular view
text: By far the best view of any restaurant in Guatemala City. Service is superb, a bit expensive and the steaks are not the best in town. The entraña is pretty good though. However, the view is awesome. Go at night to enjoy it more.

title: If you love cheese!
text: Perfect for cheese lovers. Try any of the cheese fondues, all are good. They have draft beer in great sizes, even by the yard. For dessert try the fruit with melted chocolate. Good service, and kind of romantic.

title: Fancy and fun!
text: Very nice, cozy, fancy restaurant with great plates from Argentina. The ambiance, music, smell take you to Buenos Aires. Service is great, plates look amazing. Try the beef empanadas and beef ribs. Finish your meal with a Fernet. A bit pricey. The beef sirloin is ok. Great selection of wines.

title: Always something new
text: Cayala is becoming a great place for more than just shopping. Several cultural events, a small but beautiful art gallery, many cafes and dessert places, all make for a nice and pleasant time. You can easily spend a whole day here.

title: Nice italian little restaurant
text: Had a nice time at this place. The service was very good, and menu selection was ok. I had lamb chops with a side of mashed potatoes. The sides are enormous. Beer selection was not great, tried their house wine which was good. Nice looking ladies file in and out. Small bar, seems pretty well stocked. A bit pricey, but good is definitely fresh.

title: Awesome views
text: What can be said...the place is still amazing after so many decades. Expect some waiting time due to long lines. You can purchase tickets out front and save some time. Worth the effort.

title: Great mexican flavor!
text: Very good mexican food, with a great selection of sauces for the tacos. Tried the pork and arrachera tacos. Good service. The lemonade is excellent. There is a problem with parking which needs to be fixed.

title: Magnificent!
text: Rendez Vous just recently opened its new location, and the place is just amazing. The service which has always been superior now is coupled by a beautifully decorated environment, with lots of light and outdoorsy feel. As usual, any of the plates are exquisite. This last lunch, I had the green pepper steak, and a "chico" mousse. An herbal tea (I had the red one) will be a great closing for a great lunch or dinner. This place has also one of the best lemonades in town, no kidding!

title: Fancy and cozy
text: Very nice restaurant in a quiet area of Zona 10. The ambience is lovely, and service is very good. I have tried several plates, with my favorite being their salmon, which is very well prepared and served. Try sitting outside, facing a small garden out front.

title: Great place for a quick getaway from the city!
text: We are staying a couple of nights here. The facilities are great with several cool slides and rides. Two nice restaurants with limited menus, and snacks everywhere. Not much to do outside, but you will be happy for a couple of days. Great cable with Fox News included. A place with pupusas next to the pool is awesome. Pretty good bang for your buck.
place: Resort y Parque Acuatico Valle Dorado

title: Awesome experience!
text: Wonderful experience, the oysters were the best ever. Had the Shrimp Mediterranean platter, no real words to describe it. The service was perfect, overall a wonderful experience. I will recommend this place as a "must-go" to all friends visiting South Louisiana.

title: For now, not the best option.
text: Cute little place with ok atmosphere. It is more for the younger crowd. Food is acceptable for the price. We tried several of the pizzas, some good, others not so good. Lemonade just wasn't there. If you happen to stumble upon the place, waltz in. But not the place to seek.

title: Under renovation, not a good time to visit!
text: Mall is under renovation. Lots of stores have closed. Getting in and out is a pain. Parking is awfully hard to get. For now, go elsewhere, you will not miss anything.

title: Amazng service!
text: We got to the restaurant right at the time of closing, but the waiter told us they would serve us. Not only did he provide us with service, he provided us with exceptional service. We had salads and a large pan pizza which came promptly and with great taste. Even though they were cleaning the restaurant to go home, they went out of their way to ensure we did not feel rushed. The restaurant is right next to Seralago where we stayed. The salad was fresh and the cheese on the pizza was superb.

title: Budget place just for resting
text: We stayed seven nights at the Seralago. The rate was amazingly low, and it shows. The room was clean, but with strong humidity odor. It was way smaller than what we expected. It is called a suite, but a suite it is not. However, it is well located and for what we needed it (to sleep) it did serve its purpose. If you can invest a bit more per night, there are other nicer choices.

title: Always a treat
text: We went to the one on 192 close to the Seralago. Service was great, we had a fun hostess and the food came promptly and with great flavor. This one has a nice bar if you want to just stop by for a drink.

title: Under remodelation
text: We hit the one near the Vineland Outlets. Although the restaurant is being remodeled, we hardly noticed this due to the amazing service froim our waiter. I had some amazing riblets and my kids had a delicious hamburger. No wifi on site which is great for conversation sake.

title: Crowded early
text: We visited the 192 location which was packed at 7am. However, service was quite fast and curteous. Our waitress went out of her way to accommodate the wishes of my kids. Nice location near our stops.

title: Something different
text: I visited the Sarita in Condado Concepción. Service is ok, not great, but acceptable. The food is varied, they have a healthy -choice menu, and offers lots of options. Most food is ok, but the typical (Guatemalam) dishes are good! I had the black bean soup and the "Chile Relleno" sandwich. I was floored...great tasting. I did not have room for dessert. To drink, try the "cremita", a milk based drink.

title: New place, great service.
text: Came for lunch with my kids and had a special offer of sirloin. Meat was ok, they need to work a bit on the flavor. The service was terrific, very fast and friendly. Parking is an issue. Overall a good experience, will come back to see if flavor of meat has improved.

title: Delicious breakfasts!
text: Very busy on Sundays, with a 30 minute wait time, well worth it. A complimentary selection of sweet bread starts you off. The all natural drinks are fresh (try the squash) and the breakfast plates are varied, with international selections available, from Norwegian salmon bagels to Mexican chilaquiles. Prices are great and portions are abundant.

title: Nice, relaxed atmosphere.
text: Very cozy places for a delicious afternoon snack. The sweet crepes are the best in town, and service is mostly good. I love the locations in Zone 10 or Cayala for an afternoon break or a light dinner at the location at Concepcion. Excellent prices, great value for money.

title: Delicious lasagna
text: Little quaint place in a strip mall. Several types of lasagna, all homemade taste. You can eat it there, or take a whole frozen home. Good wine and other drinks. Well worth the trip if you want to impress dinner guests.

title: Pricey but worth it.
text: You will enjoy any of the plates here. Tty the sirloin (lomito) with the Zacapa sauce and baby potatoes. Excellent selection of premium drinks Great atmosphere. Ideal for a romantic dinner.

title: Healthful and delicious!
text: This is the closest to Chipotle that you will get. Fast casual concept, excellent value, generous portions. Beer available to go with your burrito or salad. Rice bowls also available. The owners need to open more locations. Overall, great choice for staying fit and slim.

title: Guatemalan cuisine
text: Care to know what real Guatemalan cuisine tastes like? Kacao is the place to go. Very well known, within walking distance of all major hotels in Zona Viva, you should make it a stop in your itinerary. The good can be a bit spicy, but you will enjoy the range of flavors. Great atmosphere and very nicely decorated ranch.

title: Best steak in town, many years running!
text: Had a chance to go again to enjoy the best tasting, softest and tender steaks in town. We had the mixed plate (sirloin and puyaso, rare) salads and mashed potatoes. It is one and a half pounds of pure bliss. If you end up a little stuffed, have a fernet and coke, you'll feel good as new in a few seconds. Ask to be waited on by Leo.
